column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Zagaynov (Russian Federation) (spoke in Russian): I would like very briefly to respond to the\r
#Text=statement made by the representative of Ukraine.
#Text=Such attempts yet again to place all of the blame\r
#Text=for what takes place in that country onto the Russian\r
#Text=Federation come as a surprise to no one.
#Text=Even the\r
#Text=reports regarding the shelling by the Ukrainian army\r
#Text=of residential areas, in violation of international\r
#Text=humanitarian law - reports coming from a variety\r
#Text=of sources, which cannot in any way be regarded as\r
#Text=Russian propaganda - provoke no response from Kyiv\r
#Text=other than yet further accusations against the Russian\r
#Text=Federation.
#Text=Quite clearly, our Lithuanian colleagues\r
#Text=also take a selective attitude to such sources as well.
#Text=The reality is that on 13 April 2014, our delegation\r
#Text=initiated the convening of an emergency meeting of the\r
#Text=Security Council (see S/PV.7154) in order to attempt\r
#Text=to prevent the Ukrainian authorities from using armed\r
#Text=force in south-eastern Ukraine.
#Text=We were unable to do\r
#Text=so.
#Text=The so-called anti-terrorist operation was launched,\r
#Text=claiming civilian victims in its very first week.
#Text=We\r
#Text=have called again and again for an end to the violence\r
#Text=and for the initiation of a full-fledged national dialogue\r
#Text=that would avert further civilian casualties in Ukraine.
#Text=Such an appeal was made to the authorities in Kyiv\r
#Text=as recently as today by the Russian Foreign Ministry.
#Text=Unfortunately, those calls have gone unheeded to date.
#Text=In conclusion, I recall that the topic of today's\r
#Text=meeting is the protection of civilians.
#Text=Nadiya Savchenko,\r
#Text=a Ukrainian military officer, is not a civilian.
#Text=However,\r
#Text=the Russian journalists were definitely civilians, and\r
#Text=she is accused of helping to kill them.
